description: The purpose of this message and the three following messages is to allow sites with multiple systems and respective master data bases to communicate activity related to a person between systems.  Each system has an interest in the data base activity of the others in order to maintain data integrity across an institution.  While defined within the ADT message set, these messages differ in that they are not patient specific.

segments.description:
The MSH segment defines the intent, source, destination, and some specifics of the syntax of a message.

Note: If MSH-15 and MSH-16 are omitted (or are both null), the original Acknowledgement Mode rules are used.

fields.name: Field Separator
fields.description: actually the separator between the segment ID and the first real field, MSH-2-encoding characters.  As such it serves as the separator and defines the character to be used as a separator for the rest of the message.  Recommended value is |.

fields.name: Encoding Characters
fields.description: four characters in the following order: the component separator, repetition separator, escape character, and subcomponent separator.  Recommended values are ^~\&.

fields.name: Sending Application
fields.description: available for interface with lower level protocols

fields.name: Sending Facility
fields.description: addresses one of several occurrences of the same application within the sending system.  Absent other considerations, the Medicare Provider ID might be used with an appropriate sub-identifier in the second component.  Entirely site-defined

fields.name: Receiving Application
fields.description: available for interface with lower level protocols

fields.name: Receiving Facility
fields.description: identifies the receiving application among multiple identical instances of the application running on behalf of different organizations.  See comments: sending facility

fields.name: Date / Time Of Message
fields.description: date/time that the sending system created the message.  If the time zone is specified, it will be used throughout the message as the default time zone

fields.name: Security
fields.description: in some applications of HL7 this field will be used to implement security features.  Its use is not yet further specified

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: first component is the message type edited by table 0076 - message type; second is the trigger event code edited by table 0003 - event type code.  Receiving system uses this field to know the data segments to recognize, and possibly, the application to which to route this message.  For certain queries, which may have more than a single response event type, the second component may, in the response message, vary to indicate the response event type.  See the discussion of the display query variants in Section 2.8.6.1.1.  The second component is not required on response or acknowledgement messages

fields.name: Message Control Id
fields.description: number or other identifier that uniquely identifies the message.  The receiving system echoes this ID back to the sending system in the Message Acknowledgement segment (MSA).

fields.name: Processing Id
fields.description: used to decide whether to process the message as defined in HL7 Application (level 7)  Processing rules.

fields.name: Version Id
fields.description: matched by the receiving system to its own version to be sure the message will be interpreted correctly

fields.name: Sequence Number
fields.description: non-null value in this field implies that the sequence number protocol is in use.  This numeric field incremented by one for each subsequent value

fields.name: Continuation Pointer
fields.description: used to define continuations in application-specific ways

fields.name: Accept Acknowledgement Type
fields.description: defines the conditions under which accept acknowledgements are required to be returned in response to this message.  Required for enhanced acknowledgement mode.  Refer to table 0155 - acknowledgement conditions for valid values

fields.name: Application Acknowledgement Type
fields.description: defines the conditions under which  application  acknowledgements are required to be returned in response to this message.  Required for enhanced acknowledgement mode

fields.name: Country Code
fields.description: defines the country of origin for the message.  It will be used primarily to specify default elements, such as currency denominations.   ISO 3166 provides a list of country codes that may be used.

segments.description: The EVN segment is used to communicate necessary trigger event information to receiving applications.  Valid event types for all chapters are contained in table 0003 - event type code

fields.name: Event Type Code
fields.description: codes correspond to the trigger events described in this section. e.g., admission, transfer, registration.  This field is left in for backwards compatibility.  It is recommended to use the second component (trigger event) of MSH-9-message type to transmit event type code information

fields.name: Date / Time Of Event
fields.description: most systems will default to the system date/time when the transaction was entered, but should also permit an override

fields.name: Date / Time Planned Event
fields.description: date/time the event is planned.  Recommend that the PV2 expected admit date and expected discharge date be used whenever possible

fields.name: Event Reason Code
fields.description: describes the reason for this event (e.g., patient request, physician order, census management, etc.).  Refer to user-defined table 0062 - event reason for valid codes

fields.name: Operator Id
fields.description: identifies the individual responsible for triggering the event.  Refer to user-defined table 0188 - operator ID for suggested values

segments.description: The PID segment is used by all applications as the primary means of communicating patient identification information.  This segment contains permanent patient identifying, and demographic information that, for the most part, is not likely to change frequently

fields.name: Set Id - Patient Id
fields.description: for those messages that permit segments to repeat, the Set ID field is used to identify the repetitions.  For example, the swap and query transactions allow for multiple PID segments would have Set ID values of 1, 2, then 3, etc

fields.name: Patient Id (external Id)
fields.description: if the patient is from another institution, outside office, etc., the identifier used by that institution can be shown here.  This may be a number which multiple disparate corporations or facilities share.  Refer to table 0061 - check digit scheme in Chapter 2

fields.name: Code Identifying the Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: The check digit scheme codes are defined in table 0061 - check digit scheme.

fields.name: Assigning Facility ID
fields.description: The assigning facility ID is a unique name (up to six characters in length) of the system that stores the data.  It is an ST data type.  It is equivalent to the application ID of the placer or filler order number (see Chapter 4).  Assigning facility ID's are unique across a given HL7 implementation.

fields.name: Patient Id (internal Id)
fields.description: primary ID used by the facility to uniquely identify a patient at the time of admit, (e.g., medical record number, billing number, etc).  Refer to table 0061-check digit scheme

fields.name: Alternate Patient Id
fields.description: third number may be required to identify a patient.  Possible contents include a visit number, a visit date, or Social Security Number

fields.name: Patient Name
fields.description: name is standard format described in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Mother's Maiden Name
fields.description: family name under which the mother was born (i.e., before marriage.)  Used to disambiguate patients with the same last name

fields.name: Date Of Birth
fields.description: patient's date of birth

fields.name: Sex
fields.description: patient's sex.  Refer to table 0001 - sex for valid codes.

fields.name: Patient Alias
fields.description: name(s) by which the patient has been known at some time

fields.name: Race
fields.description: ERISA also has a published list of ethnic classifications which may be used by local agreement at a site.  Refer to user-defined table 0005 - race

fields.name: Patient Address
fields.description: mailing address of the patient

fields.name: County Code
fields.description: patient's county code.  This field was left in for backwards compatibility.  County can now be supported in the other geographic designation component of the AD data type

fields.name: Phone Number - Home
fields.description: up to three repetitions are permitted.  The first is considered the primary number

fields.name: Phone Number - Business
fields.description: up to three repetitions are permitted.  The first is considered the primary one

fields.name: Language - Patient
fields.description: the patient's primary language

fields.name: Marital Status
fields.description: patient's marital status.  Refer to user-defined table 0002 - marital status for suggested entries

fields.name: Religion
fields.description: patient's religion.  Refer to user-defined table 0006 - religion

fields.name: Patient Account Number
fields.description: number assigned by accounting to which all charges, payments, etc. are recorded.  It is used to identify the patient's account.  Refer to table 0061 - check digit scheme in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Code Identifying the Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: The check digit scheme codes are defined in table 0061 - check digit scheme.

fields.name: Assigning Facility ID
fields.description: The assigning facility ID is a unique name (up to six characters in length) of the system that stores the data.  It is an ST data type.  It is equivalent to the application ID of the placer or filler order number (see Chapter 4).  Assigning facility ID's are unique across a given HL7 implementation.

fields.name: Social Security Number - Patient
fields.description: patient's social security number.  This number may also be an RR retirement number

fields.name: Driver's License Number - Patient
fields.description: patient's drivers license number.  Some sites may use this as a unique number that identifies the patient.  Default of the second component is the state in which the patient is being registered

fields.name: Mother's Identifier
fields.description: used as a link field for newborns, for example.  Typically a patient ID or account number may be used.  Refer to HL7 table 0061 - check digit scheme as defined in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Code Identifying the Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: The check digit scheme codes are defined in table 0061 - check digit scheme.

fields.name: Assigning Facility ID
fields.description: The assigning facility ID is a unique name (up to six characters in length) of the system that stores the data.  It is an ST data type.  It is equivalent to the application ID of the placer or filler order number (see Chapter 4).  Assigning facility ID's are unique across a given HL7 implementation.

fields.name: Ethnic Group
fields.description: further defines patient ancestry.  Refer to user-defined table 0189 - ethnic group for suggested values

fields.name: Birth Place
fields.description: indicates the location of the patient's birth

fields.name: Multiple Birth Indicator
fields.description: indicates if the patient was part of a multiple birth.  Refer to HL7 table 0136 - Y/N indicator as described in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Birth Order
fields.description: if a patient was part of a multiple birth, a value (number) indicating the patient's birth order

fields.name: Citizenship
fields.description: indicates the patient's country of citizenship.  Refer to user-defined table 0171 - country code for suggested values or to ISO 3166

fields.name: Veterans Military Status
fields.description: indicates the military status assigned to a veteran.  Refer to user-defined table 0172 - veterans military status for suggested codes

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question.  E.g., myocardial infarction or x-ray impression.  Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system will be assigned a unique identifier.  This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.  For backward compatibility, if this component is absent, it will be taken to mean the CPT-4 with ASTM extensions, i.e., AS4.  Other coding systems that might appear here are ICD-9, ICD-10, SNOMED, etc.  Each system will be given a unique identifying string.  The current ASTM 1238-88  diagnostic/procedure/observation/drug ID/health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables below.  Others may be added as needed.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

segments.description: The NK1 segment contains information about the patient's other related parties. Any associated parties may be identified. Utilizing NK1-1-set ID, multiple NK1 segments can be sent to patient accounts

fields.name: Set Id - Next Of Kin
fields.description: uniquely identifies the NK1 records for the purpose of adding, changing, or deleting records.  For those messages that permit segments to repeat, the Set ID field is used to identify the repetitions.  For example, the swap and query transactions allow for multiple PID segments would have Set ID values of 1, 2, then 3, etc.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: name of the next of kin

fields.name: Relationship
fields.description: defines the actual personal relationship that the next of kin has to the patient.  Refer to user-defined table 0063 - relationship.  Examples might include: brother, sister, mother, father, friend, spouse, emergency contact, employer, etc

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question.  E.g., myocardial infarction or x-ray impression.  Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system will be assigned a unique identifier.  This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.  For backward compatibility, if this component is absent, it will be taken to mean the CPT-4 with ASTM extensions, i.e., AS4.  Other coding systems that might appear here are ICD-9, ICD-10, SNOMED, etc.  Each system will be given a unique identifying string.  The current ASTM 1238-88  diagnostic/procedure/observation/drug ID/health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables below.  Others may be added as needed.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Address
fields.description: defines the address of the associated party

fields.name: Phone Number
fields.description: defines the telephone number of the associated party

fields.name: Business Phone Number
fields.description: defines the business telephone number of the associated party

fields.name: Contact Role
fields.description: indicates the specific relationship role (next of kin, employer, emergency contact, etc.).  Refer to userdefined table 0131 - contact role.  This field specifies the role that the next of kin plays with regards to the patient.  For example, an employer, emergency contact, next of kin, insurance company, state agency, federal agency etc.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question.  E.g., myocardial infarction or x-ray impression.  Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system will be assigned a unique identifier.  This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.  For backward compatibility, if this component is absent, it will be taken to mean the CPT-4 with ASTM extensions, i.e., AS4.  Other coding systems that might appear here are ICD-9, ICD-10, SNOMED, etc.  Each system will be given a unique identifying string.  The current ASTM 1238-88  diagnostic/procedure/observation/drug ID/health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables below.  Others may be added as needed.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Start Date
fields.description: start of relationship

fields.name: End Date
fields.description: end of relationship

fields.name: Next Of Kin
fields.description: title of the next of kin at their place of employment

fields.name: Next Of Kin Job Code / Class
fields.description: the employers Job Code or Employee Classification used for the next of kin at their place of employment

fields.name: Next Of Kin Employee Number
fields.description: number the employer assigns to the employee that is acting as next of kin

fields.name: Organization Name
fields.description: in cases where an employer serves as next of kin, this is the name of the organization which serves as the next of kin.  This field may also be used to communicate the name of the organization where the next of kin works.

segments.description: The PV1 segment is used by Registration/ADT applications to communicate information on a visit specific basis.  This segment can be used to send multiple visit statistic records to the same patient account, or single visit records to more than one account.  Individual sites must determine this segment's use

fields.name: Set Id - Patient Visit
fields.description: number that uniquely identifies this transaction for the purpose of adding, changing, or deleting the transaction.  For those messages that permit segments to repeat, the Set ID field is used to identify the repetitions.  For example, the swap and query transactions allow for multiple PID segments would have Set ID values of 1, 2, then 3, etc.

fields.name: Patient Class
fields.description: a common field used by systems to categorize patients by site.  It does not have a consistent industrywide definition.  Subject to site-specific variations.  Refer to user-defined table 0004 - patient class for suggested codes

fields.name: Assigned Patient Location
fields.dataTypeName: Cm For Location Information In Hospital
fields.description: New location is the patient's initial assigned location, or the location to which he is being moved.  For canceling a transaction or discharging a patient, the current room number should be in this field.  If a value exists in the fifth component (bed status) it supercedes the value in 3.3.3.40

fields.name: Admission Type
fields.description: indicates the circumstance under which the patient was or will be admitted

fields.name: Preadmit Number
fields.description: uniquely identifies the patient's pre-admit account.  Some systems will continue to use the pre-admit number as the billing number after the patient has been admitted.  In the future, this field should be a CK data type -- like the account number

fields.name: Prior Patient Location
fields.dataTypeName: Cm For Location Information In Hospital
fields.description: old location is null if the patient is new.  It contains the prior patient location if the patient is being transferred.  If a value exists in the fifth component (bed status) it supercedes the value in 3.3.3.40

fields.name: Attending Doctor
fields.description: Depending on local agreements, either ID or the name may be absent.  Refer to user-defined table 0010 - physician ID

fields.name: Referring Doctor
fields.description: depending on local agreements, either ID or the name may be absent.  Refer to user-defined table 0010 - physician ID

fields.name: Consulting Doctor
fields.description: depending on local agreements, either ID or the name may be absent.  Refer to user-defined table 0010 - physician ID

fields.name: Hospital Service
fields.description: The treatment or type of surgery the patient is scheduled to receive.  Required field with trigger events A01, A02, A14, A15.  Refer to user-defined table 0069 - hospital service

fields.name: Temporary Location
fields.dataTypeName: Cm For Location Information In Hospital
fields.description: location other than the assigned location required for a temporary period of time (e.g., OR).  If a value exists in the fifth component (bed status) it supercedes the value in 3.3.3.40

fields.name: Preadmit Test Indicator
fields.description: indicates that the patient must have pre-admission testing done in order to be admitted.  Refer to userdefined table 0087 - pre-admit test indicator for suggested codes

fields.name: Readmission Indicator
fields.description: indicates that a patient is being re-admitted to the facility and the circumstances.  R for readmission or else null.  Also recurring patient visits can be indicated.  Refer to user-defined table 0092 - re-admission indicator

fields.name: Admit Source
fields.description: indicates where the patient was admitted.  Refer to user-defined table 0023 - admit source for suggested codes

fields.name: Ambulatory Status
fields.description: refer to user-defined table 0009 - ambulatory status for suggested entries

fields.name: Vip Indicator
fields.description: user-defined code to identify the type of VIP.  Refer to user-defined table 0099 - VIP indicator

fields.name: Admitting Doctor
fields.description: by local agreement name or ID may not be present.  Refer to user-defined table 0010 - physician ID

fields.name: Patient Type
fields.description: site-specific values.  Refer user-defined table 0018 - patient type

fields.name: Visit Number
fields.description: unique number assigned to each patient visit.  This is left as NM data type for backwards compatibility but HL7 recommends new implementations use CK data type

fields.name: Financial Class
fields.description: primary financial class assigned to the patient for the purpose of identifying sources of reimbursement.  Repeats up to 4 times.  Refer to user-defined table 0064 - financial class for suggested codes

fields.name: Charge Price Indicator
fields.description: code used to determine which price schedule is to be used for room and bed charges.  Refer to userdefined table 0032 - charge/price indicator

fields.name: Courtesy Code
fields.description: code that indicates whether the patient will be extended certain special courtesies.  Refer to user-defined table 0045 - courtesy code

fields.name: Credit Rating
fields.description: user-defined code to determine past credit experience.  Refer user-defined table 0046 - credit rating

fields.name: Contract Code
fields.description: identifies the type of contract entered into by the facility and the guarantor for the purpose of settling outstanding account balances.  Refer to user-defined table 0044 - contract code

fields.name: Contract Effective Date
fields.description: date the contract is to start.

fields.name: Contract Amount
fields.description: amount to be paid by the guarantor each period as per the contract

fields.name: Contract Period
fields.description: specifies the duration of the contract for user-defined periods

fields.name: Interest Code
fields.description: indicates the amount of interest that will be charged the guarantor on any outstanding amounts.  Refer to user-defined table 0073 - interest rate code

fields.name: Transfer To Bad Debt - Code
fields.description: indicates the account was transferred to bad debts and the reason.  Refer to user-defined table 0110 - transfer to bad debt code

fields.name: Transfer To Bad Debt - Date
fields.description: date that the account was transferred to a bad debt status

fields.name: Bad Debt Agency Code
fields.description: uniquely identifies the bad debt agency that the account was transferred to.  This code is site-defined.  This field was kept as an ST type for backwards compatibility.  One possible implementation is to edit against a table such as, user-defined table 0021 - bad debt agency code, however this is not required

fields.name: Bad Debt Transfer Amount
fields.description: amount that was transferred to a bad debt status

fields.name: Bad Debt Recovery Amount
fields.description: amount recovered from the guarantor on the account

fields.name: Delete Account Indicator
fields.description: indicates that the account was deleted from the file and the reason.  Refer to user-defined table 0111 - delete account code

fields.name: Delete Account Date
fields.description: date that the account was deleted from the file

fields.name: Discharge Disposition
fields.description: disposition of the patient at time of discharge (i.e., discharged to home; expired; etc.).  Refer to userdefined table 0112 - discharged disposition

fields.name: Discharged To Location
fields.description: indicates a facility to which the patient was discharged.  Refer to user-defined table 0113  - discharged to location

fields.name: Diet Type
fields.description: indicates a special diet type for a patient.  Refer to user-defined table 0114 - diet type

fields.name: Servicing Facility
fields.description: used in a multiple facility environment to indicate the facility with which this visit is associated.  Refer to user-defined table 0115 - servicing facility

fields.name: Bed Status
fields.description: efer to user-defined table 0116 - bed status

fields.name: Account Status
fields.description: refer to user-defined table 0117 - account status

fields.name: Pending Location
fields.dataTypeName: Cm For Location Information In Hospital
fields.description: indicates the nursing station, room, bed, facility ID and bed status to which the patient may be moved.  If a value exists in the fifth component (bed status) it supercedes the value in 3.3.3.40

fields.name: Prior Temporary Location
fields.dataTypeName: Cm For Location Information In Hospital
fields.description: can be used when a patient is arriving or departing or for general update events.   If a value exists in the fifth component (bed status) it supercedes the value in 3.3.3.40

fields.name: Admit Date / Time
fields.description: admit date/time.  To be used if the event date/time is different than the admit date and time, i.e., a retroactive update

fields.name: Discharge Date / Time
fields.description: discharge date/time.  To be used if the event date/time is different than the admit date and time, i.e., a retroactive update

fields.name: Current Patient Balance
fields.description: visit balance due

fields.name: Total Charges
fields.description: total visit charges

fields.name: Total Adjustments
fields.description: total adjustments for visit

fields.name: Total Payments
fields.description: total payments for visit

fields.name: Alternate Visit Id
fields.description: optional visit ID number to be used if needed.   -  ID used by the facility to uniquely identify a patient at the time of admit.  Refer to HL7 table 0061 - check digit scheme as defined in Chapter 2.  Refer to userdefined table 0192 - visit ID type

segments.description: The PV2 segment is a continuation of visit specific information contained on the PV1 segment.

fields.name: Prior Pending Location
fields.dataTypeName: Cm For Location Information In Hospital
fields.description: required only for Cancel Pending Transfer (A27) messages

fields.name: Accommodation Code
fields.description: indicates the specific patient accommodations for this visit.  Refer to user-defined table 0129 - accommodation code

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question.  E.g., myocardial infarction or x-ray impression.  Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system will be assigned a unique identifier.  This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.  For backward compatibility, if this component is absent, it will be taken to mean the CPT-4 with ASTM extensions, i.e., AS4.  Other coding systems that might appear here are ICD-9, ICD-10, SNOMED, etc.  Each system will be given a unique identifying string.  The current ASTM 1238-88  diagnostic/procedure/observation/drug ID/health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables below.  Others may be added as needed.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Admit Reason
fields.description: short description the patient admission reason

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question.  E.g., myocardial infarction or x-ray impression.  Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system will be assigned a unique identifier.  This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.  For backward compatibility, if this component is absent, it will be taken to mean the CPT-4 with ASTM extensions, i.e., AS4.  Other coding systems that might appear here are ICD-9, ICD-10, SNOMED, etc.  Each system will be given a unique identifying string.  The current ASTM 1238-88  diagnostic/procedure/observation/drug ID/health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables below.  Others may be added as needed.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Transfer Reason
fields.description: short description of the patient location change reason

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question.  E.g., myocardial infarction or x-ray impression.  Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system will be assigned a unique identifier.  This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Patient Valuables
fields.description: short description of patient valuables checked in during admission

fields.name: Patient Valuables Location
fields.description: indicates the location of the patient's valuables

fields.name: Visit User Code
fields.description: further categorizes a patient's visit with respect to an individual institution's needs (e.g., teaching flag = TE, indicating the patient is a teaching case).  Refer to user-defined table 0130 - visit user code

fields.name: Expected Admit Date
fields.description: date patient expected to be admitted

fields.name: Expected Discharge Date
fields.description: non-event related date used by ancillaries to more accurately determine projected workloads

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question.  E.g., myocardial infarction or x-ray impression.  Its data type is string (ST).

segments.description: The AL1 segment contains patient allergy information of various types.  Most of this information will be derived from user-defined tables.  Each AL1 segment describes a single patient allergy

fields.name: Set Id - Allergy
fields.description: number that uniquely identifies the individual transaction for adding, deleting or updating an allergy description in the patient's record.  For those messages that permit segments to repeat, the Set ID field is used to identify the repetitions.  For example, the swap and query transactions allow for multiple PID segments would have Set ID values of 1, 2, then 3, etc

fields.name: Allergy Type
fields.description: indicates a general allergy category (drug, food, pollen, etc.).

fields.name: Allergy Code / Mnemonic / Description
fields.description: uniquely identifies a particular allergy.  This element may conform to some external, standard coding system (which must be identified), or it may conform to local, largely textual or mnemonic descriptions

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question.  E.g., myocardial infarction or x-ray impression.  Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system will be assigned a unique identifier.  This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.  For backward compatibility, if this component is absent, it will be taken to mean the CPT-4 with ASTM extensions, i.e., AS4.  Other coding systems that might appear here are ICD-9, ICD-10, SNOMED, etc.  Each system will be given a unique identifying string.  The current ASTM 1238-88  diagnostic/procedure/observation/drug ID/health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables below.  Others may be added as needed.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Allergy Severity
fields.description: indicates the general severity of the allergy (severe, moderate, mild, etc.).

fields.name: Allergy Reaction
fields.description: short, textual description of the specific allergy reaction (convulsions, sneeze, rash, etc.).

fields.name: Identification Date
fields.description: date the allergy was identified.

segments.description: The DG1 segment contains patient diagnosis information of various types.  For example: Admitting, Current, Primary, Final, etc.  Coding methodologies are also defined

fields.name: Set Id - Diagnosis
fields.description: sequence number that uniquely identifies the individual transaction for adding, deleting, and updating the diagnosis in the patient's record

fields.name: Diagnosis Coding Method
fields.description: ICD9 is the recommended coding methodology.  Refer to user-defined table 0053- diagnosis coding method

fields.name: Diagnosis Code
fields.description: diagnosis code assigned to this diagnosis.  Refer to user-defined table 0051- diagnosis code

fields.name: Diagnosis Description
fields.description: description that best describes the diagnosis

fields.name: Diagnosis Date / Time
fields.description: date/time the diagnosis was determined

fields.name: Diagnosis / Drg Type
fields.description: code identifies the type of diagnosis being sent.  Valid types could include: Admitting, Final, etc.  Refer to user-defined table 0052- diagnosis type

fields.name: Major Diagnostic Category
fields.description: refer to user-defined table 0118 - major diagnostic category

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question.  E.g., myocardial infarction or x-ray impression.  Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system will be assigned a unique identifier.  This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.  For backward compatibility, if this component is absent, it will be taken to mean the CPT-4 with ASTM extensions, i.e., AS4.  Other coding systems that might appear here are ICD-9, ICD-10, SNOMED, etc.  Each system will be given a unique identifying string.  The current ASTM 1238-88  diagnostic/procedure/observation/drug ID/health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables below.  Others may be added as needed.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Diagnostic Related Group
fields.description: DRG for the transaction.  Interim DRG's could be determined for an encounter.  Refer to user-defined table 0055- DRG code

fields.name: Drg Approval Indicator
fields.description: indicates if the DRG has been approved by a reviewing entity

fields.name: Drg Grouper Review Code
fields.description: refer to user-defined table 0056 - DRG grouper review code.  This code indicates that the grouper results have been reviewed and approved

fields.name: Outlier Type
fields.description: Refer to user-defined table 0083 - outlier type.  The type of outlier that has been paid

fields.name: Outlier Days
fields.description: number of days that have been approved as an outlier payment

fields.name: Outlier Cost
fields.description: amount of money that has been approved as a payment

fields.name: Grouper Version And Type
fields.description: grouper version and type

fields.name: Diagnosis / Drg Priority
fields.description: number which identifies the significance or priority of the diagnosis or DRG code

fields.name: Diagnosing Clinician
fields.description: individual responsible for generating the diagnosis information

segments.description: The PR1 segment contains information relative to various types of procedures that can be performed on a patient.  For example: Surgical, Nuclear Medicine, X-Ray with contrast, etc

fields.name: Set Id - Procedure
fields.description: unique number that is used to identify a transaction for the purpose of adding, changing or deleting entries.

fields.name: Procedure Coding Method
fields.description: methodology used to assign a code to the procedure (CPT4 for example).  If more than one coding method is needed for a single procedure,  this field and associated PR1-3-procedure code and PR1-4procedure description may repeat.  In this instance, the three fields (PR1-2 through 4) are directly associated with one another.  Refer to user-defined table 0089 - procedure coding method for suggested values

fields.name: Procedure Code
fields.description: unique identifier assigned to the procedure.  Refer to user-defined table 0088 - procedure code for suggested values

fields.name: Procedure Description
fields.description: text description that describes the procedure

fields.name: Procedure Date / Time
fields.description: date/time the procedure was performed

fields.name: Procedure Type
fields.description: optional code that further defines the type of procedure.  Refer to user-defined table 0090 - procedure type for suggested values

fields.name: Procedure Minutes
fields.description: length of time in whole minutes that the procedure took to complete

fields.name: Anesthesiologist
fields.description: Anesthesiologist who administered the anesthesia.  It is recommended that PR1-12-procedure MD be used instead of this field.  This field remains only for backward compatibility.  Refer to user-defined table 0010 - physician ID.

fields.name: Anesthesia Code
fields.description: uniquely identifies the anesthesia used during the procedure.  It is recommended that PR1-12-procedure MD be used instead of this field.  This field remains only for backward compatibility

fields.name: Anesthesia Minutes
fields.description: length of time in minutes that the anesthesia was administered

fields.name: Surgeon
fields.description: surgeon who performed the procedure. It is recommended that PR1-12-procedure MD be used instead of this field.  This field remains only for backward compatibility.  Refer to user-defined table 0010 - physician ID

fields.name: Procedure Practitioner
fields.description: different types of practitioners associated with this procedure.  The ID and name components follow the standard rules defined for a composite name (CN) field.  If the procedure type component is unvalued, it is assumed that the physician identified is a resident.  Refer to user-defined table 0010 - physician ID.  Refer to user-defined table 0133 - procedure practitioner type for suggested entries.

fields.name: Consent Code
fields.description: type of consent that was obtained for permission to treat the patient.  Refer to user-defined table 0059 - consent code

fields.name: Procedure Priority
fields.description: number which identifies the significance or priority of the procedure code

segments.description: The GT1 segment contains guarantor (e.g., person with financial responsibility for payment of a patient account) data for patient and insurance billing applications

fields.name: Set Id - Guarantor
fields.description: number that uniquely identifies the transaction for the purpose of adding, changing, or deleting a transaction

fields.name: Guarantor Number
fields.description: unique number assigned to the guarantor

fields.name: Guarantor Name
fields.description: name of the guarantor

fields.name: Guarantor Spouse Name
fields.description: name of the guarantor's spouse

fields.name: Guarantor Address
fields.description: guarantor's address

fields.name: Guarantor Phone Number - Home
fields.description: guarantor's home phone number

fields.name: Guarantor Phone Number - Business
fields.description: guarantor's business phone number

fields.name: Guarantor Date Of Birth
fields.description: guarantor's date of birth

fields.name: Guarantor Sex
fields.description: refer to table 0001 - sex for valid entries

fields.name: Guarantor Type
fields.description: type of guarantor, e.g., individual, institution, etc.  Refer to user-defined table 0068 - guarantor type

fields.name: Guarantor Relationship
fields.description: relationship of the guarantor with the patient, e.g., parent, child, etc.  Refer to user-defined table 0063 - guarantor relationship

fields.name: Guarantor Social Security Number
fields.description: guarantor's social security number

fields.name: Guarantor Date - Begin
fields.description: date the guarantor becomes responsible for the patient's account

fields.name: Guarantor Date - End
fields.description: date the guarantor stops being responsible for the patient's account

fields.name: Guarantor Priority
fields.description: used to determine the order in which the guarantors will be responsible for the patient's account

fields.name: Guarantor Employer Name
fields.description: name of the guarantor's employer

fields.name: Guarantor Employer Address
fields.description: guarantor's employer's address

fields.name: Guarantor Employ Phone Number
fields.description: guarantor's employer phone number

fields.name: Guarantor Employee Id Number
fields.description: guarantor's employee number

fields.name: Guarantor Employment Status
fields.description: code that indicates the guarantor's employment status. e.g., Full Time, Part Time, Self Employed, etc.  Refer to user-defined table 0066 - employment status

segments.description: The ACC segment contains patient information relative to an accidentin which the patient has been involved.

fields.name: Accident Date / Time
fields.description: date/time of the accident

fields.name: Accident Code
fields.description: type of accident.  Refer to user-defined table 0050 - accident code

fields.name: Accident Location
fields.description: location of the accident

segments.description: The UB1 segment contains data necessary to complete UB82 bills.  Only UB82 data elements that do not exist in other HL7 defined segments will appear in this segment.  Patient name and Date of Birth are required for UB82 billing, however, they are included in the PID segment and therefore do not appear here

fields.name: Set Id - Ub82
fields.description: number used to uniquely identify the transaction for the purpose of adding, changing, or deleting the entry

fields.name: Blood Deductible (43)
fields.description: It is recommended that IN2-21-blood deductible be used instead of this field as the blood deductible can be associated with the specific insurance plan via that segment

fields.name: Blood Furnished Pints Of (40)
fields.description: amount of blood furnished the patient for this visit.  The (40) indicates the corresponding UB82 Data Element number

fields.name: Blood Replaced Pints (41)
fields.description: UB82 Data Element 41.

fields.name: Blood Not Replaced Pints (42)
fields.description: Blood not replaced.  Measured in pints.  UB82 Data Element 42

fields.name: Co-insurance Days (25)
fields.description: UB82 Data Element 25.

fields.name: Condition Code (35-39)
fields.description: repeats 5 times.  UB82 Data Elements (35), (36), (37), (38),and (39).   Refer to user-defined table 0043 - condition code for suggested values

fields.name: Covered Days (23)
fields.description: UB82 Data Element 23

fields.name: Non-covered Days (24)
fields.description: UB82 Data Element 24

fields.name: Value Amount And Code (46-49)
fields.description: pair can repeat up to eight times.  (46A, 47A, 48A, 49A, 46B, 47B, 48B, and 49B).  Refer to userdefined table 0153 - value code for suggested values

fields.name: Number Of Grace Days (90)
fields.description: UB82 Data Element 90

fields.name: Special Program Indicator (44)
fields.description: special program indicator.  UB82 Data Element 44.

fields.name: Psro / Ur Approval Indicator (87)
fields.description: PSRO/UR approval indicator.  UB82 data element 87

fields.name: Psro / Ur Approved Stay - From (88)
fields.description: PSRO/UR approved stay date (from).  UB82 Data Element 88.

fields.name: Psro / Ur Approved Stay - To (89)
fields.description: PSRO/UR approved stay date (to).  UB82 Data Element 89

fields.name: Occurrence (28-32)
fields.description: set of values can repeat up to five times.  UB82 Data Elements 28-32

fields.name: Occurrence Span (33)
fields.description: UB82 Data Element 33.

fields.name: Occurrence Span Start Date (33)
fields.description: occurrence span start date.  UB82 Data Element 33

fields.name: Occurrence Span End Date (33)
fields.description: occurrence span end date.  UB82 Data Element 33.

fields.name: Ub-82 Locator 2
fields.description: defined by UB-82 HICFA specification

fields.name: Ub-82 Locator 9
fields.description: defined by UB-82 HICFA specification

fields.name: Ub-82 Locator 27
fields.description: defined by UB-82 HICFA specification

fields.name: Ub-82 Locator 45
fields.description: defined by UB-82 HICFA specification

segments.description: The UB2 segment contains data necessary to complete UB92 bills.  Only UB92 data elements that do not exist in other HL7 defined segments will appear in this segment.  Just as with the UB82 billing, Patient Name and Date of Birth are required, they are included in the PID segment and therefore do not appear here.  Where the field locators are different on the UB92, when compared to the UB82, the element is listed with its new location in parentheses ().

fields.name: Set Id - Ub92
fields.description: number used to uniquely identify the transaction for the purpose of adding, changing, or deleting the entry

fields.name: Co-insurance Days (9)
fields.description: UB92 data element 9.

fields.name: Condition Code (24-30)
fields.description: repeats up to seven times.  UB92 data elements 24-30.  Refer to user-defined table 0043 - condition code.

fields.name: Covered Days (7)
fields.description: UB92 data element 7.

fields.name: Non-covered Days (8)
fields.description: UB92 data element 8.

fields.name: Value Amount And Code (39-41)
fields.description: pair can repeat up to 12 times.  UB92 data elements 39a, 39b, 39c, 39d, 40a, 40b, 40c, 40d, 41a, 41b, 41c, 41d.

fields.name: Occurrence Code And Date (32-35)
fields.description: set of values can repeat up to eight times.  UB92 data elements 32a, 32b, 33a, 33b, 34a, 34b, 35a, 35b

fields.name: Occurrence Span Code / Dates (36)
fields.description: can repeat up to two times.  UB92 data element 36a, 36b.

fields.name: Ub92 Locator 2 (state)
fields.description: may repeat up to two times

fields.name: Ub92 Locator 11 (state)
fields.description: may repeat up to two times

fields.name: Ub92 Locator 31 (national)
fields.description: defined by HICFA or other regulatory agencies

fields.name: Document Control Number (37)
fields.description: number assigned by payor.  Used for rebilling/adjustment purposes.  May repeat up to 3 times.  UB92 data element 37

fields.name: Ub92 Locator 49 (national)
fields.description: may repeat up to 23 times

fields.name: Ub92 Locator 56 (state)
fields.description: may repeat up to five times

fields.name: Ub92 Locator 57 (national)
fields.description: defined by UB-92 HICFA specification

fields.name: Ub92 Locator 78 (state)
fields.description: may repeat up to two times
